column4: if you have an encrypted /home/, do you only need your sudo password to transfer that same /home/ to a new install and flavor or do you need some other password? Also, how would you go about transferring /home/ to a new install?
the copying of /home is same, and of course you also need the key for the crypted part
how do you obtain your key?
when you set the crypt up, you have to set it
i didn't set it
i just did the auto setup
how do i obtain it
I think you speak about EncFS, done at setup, that's handled by a kernelmodule and will be found again in a fresh installation
i need to copy my old home folder to a new installation. i want to change to a new flavor
yes, just do in a seperate partition, get the blkid of it and set fstab to it, pastebin of you current fstab ?
im sorry but i dont know what you're talking about at all
can also do so at setup of fresh install
sudo apt-get install pastebinit
pastebinit /etc/fstab                   <<give url here
why do you want me to pastebin something?
to get an idea of your current setup
will what hiexpo said work?
yes
can also save from the opened home to an external and just copy back
use rsync -r -P instead of copy
cool. what does rsync -r -P do and in what setting would I preform it?
it's an advanced algorithm, faster, more reliable, -r for subfolders , -P for progress
